title: Quiz 7: Home Based Care for PLWHA
topicName: Unit Six: STIs and HIV AIDS
description: Assess your knowledge of Home Based Care principles, the continuum of care, and symptom management at home.

questions.question: Home Based Care is a ___BLANK___ of care, from the health facility, to the community, to the family.
questions.explanation: It represents a 'continuum of care' ensuring support at all levels.

questions.question: What are the four components of comprehensive Home Based Care? (Select 4)
questions.explanation: The four components are Clinical, Nursing, Counselling/Spiritual, and Social support.
questions.hint: Think about the holistic needs: medical, physical, mental, and social.

questions.question: Match the Symptom with the appropriate Home Nursing Care:

pairs.right: Keep dry, calamine lotion, turn patient

questions.explanation: Fever -> Cool down. Diarrhoea -> Rehydrate. Skin -> Clean/Dry. Respiratory -> Ventilation/Soothing.
questions.hint: Match the remedy to the problem.

questions.question: Which of the following is an objective of Home Based Care?

options.text: To isolate the patient from the community

questions.explanation: One main reason for HBC is that hospitals cannot cope with the numbers; it decongests facilities while providing quality care.
questions.hint: Think about the burden on hospitals.

questions.question: Caring for caregivers is a principle of Home Based Care to minimize physical and spiritual exhaustion.
questions.explanation: True. Caregivers face burnout and need support to maintain the quality of care.

questions.question: What is a 'Physical Need' of a PLWHA?
questions.explanation: Nutrition is a physical need. Forgiveness is spiritual. Respect is social. Encouragement is psychological.

questions.question: Order the steps in managing a fever at home:

items.text: Refer if fever persists with other symptoms

questions.explanation: Hydrate -> Cool -> Medicate -> Refer if severe.
questions.hint: Safety first (hydration), then comfort, then drugs, then help.

questions.question: When should a patient with diarrhoea be referred to a health facility?

options.text: If they have one loose stool
If signs of severe dehydration or blood in stool appear
If they are drinking too much water

questions.explanation: Referral is needed for danger signs like severe dehydration, blood in stool, fever, or vomiting.

questions.question: What traditional remedy is mentioned in the text for treating Shingles (Herpes Zoster) in some areas?
questions.explanation: The text mentions the sap of the Frangipani tree (Plumeria Rubra) has been used with success.
questions.hint: It comes from a specific tree/flower.

questions.question: Why is the family considered the foundation of care for PLWHA?

options.text: They provide holistic care in the patient's own environment

questions.explanation: The family provides continuous, holistic support (physical, emotional, social) in a familiar environment.
